Dialogue: Hey, we're all done out here.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Ah, he means, we're all done having loads of fun out here.

Speaker: hank
Dialogue: Wonderful. You can have all the fun you want. This place is for fun.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Yes. Yes, it is. Thank you. Thank you both.

Speaker: hank
Dialogue: Before I say goodbye, Curt, I want to tell you I hope you'll be taking along with you a little piece of this place.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: I think I have.

Speaker: hank
Dialogue: Good. Don't forget us.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: No, I won't forget you and you won't forget me.

Speaker: hank
Dialogue: Good-bye and good luck.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: 'Bye.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: It was nice to meet yuh.

Dialogue: Right. What he said goes for me, too.

Dialogue: Yeah, you just might make it as a Pharoah yet, boy.

Speaker: hank
Dialogue: Some day he'll make a fine Moose.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: I thought I heard something.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Wait a minute!

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: The radio is gone... That means--the car is gone!

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Oh no!!! OH NO!!!

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Oh God--I'm sorry. But, why the car? You could have struck us with lightning or something--anything--- but not the car!

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: You know, it doesn't make sense to leave home to look for a home, to give up a life to find a new life, to say goodbye to friends you love just to find new friends.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: What? Say that again, I didn't--

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: That's what Curt said.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Oh, figures.  You must've talked his ear off trying to get him to stay.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: That's not true. I didn't say anything. Curt just said at dinner tonight he realized there was no big hurry. He thought he should take it easy for a while, go to J.C. and try to figure out what he wants to do with his life.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: That sounds logical.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: You think so?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Sure. I think Curt's probably right for Curt. Not for me though. Laurie, look at me. Now you know what I want out of life. And it's just not in this town.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: I'm not going to the airport tomorrow.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Steve! Don't.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: It's our last night together for three months... come on.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: We've been through this before.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I'm going to miss you so much. I need something to remember you by. You don't want me to forget you.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: What's wrong? You're just lying there.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Well go ahead, you want to.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Not like that.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: If you're not going to remember me for anything else, why don't you go ahead?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You want it and you know it. Don't be so damn self-righteous with me. After those things you told me about watching your brother--

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: You're disgusting! Get out of my car! I told you never--

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Get out! It's not worth it. I don't care if you're leaving--now get out!

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Anyway, the Goat Killer--

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Let's talk about something else.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: --Whenever he strikes, he leaves a bloody goat's head near the victim. Isn't that creepy?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: They thought he went up to Stockton, but two nights ago they found Carlie Johnson and Don White right here by the canal all hacked to pieces and--

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Who do you think'll take the regionals this--

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: --not only were there bloody goats' heads, but he had switched all the parts of their bodies around. You know putting her arms on him and his legs on--

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Wait a second. Did you hear...?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: You think it's the Goat Killer?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: No! I mean, no. Listen, I'll go for help, you stay here.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Come on, we'll hide in the field.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Maybe if it's the Goat Killer he'll get somebody and we'll see the whole thing.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: I don't want to see the whole thing. Especially if it's us he--oh, why me? I'm going to look lousy with your legs and a goat's head and--

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Shhh--he's stopped. I can't see him very--I think he's coming this way.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Well, as long as he's not--Debbie! Debbie!

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Who, me? Why me?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Terry.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Steve!

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Where'd you go, anyway?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Over there.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Well, don't go off again. Come on, let's get out of here.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: What're you doing out here? Hey, where's my rod?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Um, oh, did I introduce you? This is Debbie. Debbie, this is Steve.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Well, what about my car?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Um... I'ts in the garage. I put it in the garage for safe keeping. I mean... I don't want to take any chances with it.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Oh, great.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Yeah. Yeah. It's a good thing too. 'Cause somebody stole our car.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Really? That's terrible. What kind was it?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Gee, ah, where's Laurie, anyway?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I guess we broke up.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: You broke up? Bull!

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: It doesn't look like a gear shift knob.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Come on, will ya? Give it back to me.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Well, go ahead, cream me. What's wrong, you're a tough guy. Break my arm, see if I care.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Forget it.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: I was just going to keep it for a little while. You're an ogre, just like my father. He won't let me play records, or stay out late, or anything.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: He ah--doesn't like you to stay out late?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: No--he's terrible. Once I was at a party that didn't end till late and he called the cops. Can you imagine? It was only a little after midnight and he had the whole police force--

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Say, where do you live anyway?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Over on Ramona, why?  Oh no. Uh uh. You thought I'd tell you where--not me, not old Carol. The night is young and I'm not hitting the rack until I get a little action.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: What do you keep lookin' at?  Who's that? You know him? He's following awful close.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Grab onto something.

Speaker: falfa
Dialogue: Sorry if I scared ya, man.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Takes more than that to scare me.

Speaker: falfa
Dialogue: Where ya been hiding? Didn't anyone tell ya I been looking for ya?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Hey, I can't keep tracka all the punks lookin' for me.

Speaker: falfa
Dialogue: They say you're the fastest thing in the Valley. But that can't be your car, man. That must be your mama's car. Hell, I feel embarrassed just getting near ya.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Ya should, man--you're driving a field car.

Speaker: falfa
Dialogue: Field car? What's a Field Car?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Field Cars drive through the fields, dropping cow shit all over the place to make the lettuce grow.

Speaker: falfa
Dialogue: That's pretty good. Hey, I like that paint job you got. What they call that--sorta a cross between Piss Yellow and Puke Green, ain't it?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah, well, you're car's so ugly you must have to sneak up on the pumps to get a tank of gas.

Speaker: falfa
Dialogue: Well, at least I don't have to move over to let a funeral go by, man.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Your car's uglier than I am.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: That didn't come out right...

Speaker: falfa
Dialogue: Come on, boy, prove it. Let's go.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Look kid, why don't you go out and win a few races, then come back and see me.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Oh, race him, you can beat him.

Speaker: falfa
Dialogue: Hey, that's a tough lookin' girl you got with you, man. What're you doin'? Trying to pick up a few extra bucks babysitting?  Hey, Doll. Why don't you come on and ride with me--in about ten years?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Leave her out of this. This is just between you and me.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Wow! He's really fast, isn't he?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah. But he's stupid.

Dialogue: Hey--any of you guys know a blonde in a white T-Bird?

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Yeah, I seen her, what about it?

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: I was just wondering who she is.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: She's outta your price range, man. My brother's been with her and he clued me in.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Price range? You mean she's a--

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Yeah, Thirty Dollar Sheri. Can you believe that? Thirty dollars.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: We must be thinking of different blondes.

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: Hey man, don't tell Joe what he thinks.

Speaker: ants
Dialogue: Thirty dollars ain't much. I saw ten thousand once. My old man had it in a suitcase. They caught him the next morning though.

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: Fuzz ahead, watch it.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: Fuzz ahead, watch it.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: At Jerrie's Cherries. You can just barely see the fender.

Speaker: ants
Dialogue: That's rotten, man. Hiding like that.

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: That's shitty.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: It's dishonest.

Dialogue: We oughta do something. I got an idea. I got a good idea.

Dialogue: I think I'm gonna go over to Burger City.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Yeah. Yeah. Laurie's probably over there.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: You really think she's got me worried about where she is, don't you?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Well...

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Let me tell you something. I couldn't care less. Want to come along?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Yeah, I do. I do.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Make up your minds.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: No, thanks. U'mm. You know we got to report the car missing.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: All right. See yuh.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Yeah. See yuh.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Why can't we go to Burger City?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Burger City? Burger City!!? How can you think of hamburgers when somebody stole my car.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Listen, ah--Carl, I--

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Curt.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Curt.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Despite you scratching Gil's car, I like you. And I know what you'd like more than anything right now. Like every guy in town, you got the same secret dream, right?

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Ya want to join the Pharoahs. Huh? You can admit it--you'd like to--but you never dreamed it could be possible, did you?

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Well, tonight, I'm goin' to give you your chance.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Get down!

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Okay. Now you got it? I'm stayin' here. You're on your own.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Wait a minute, wait a minute, Joe. What if he hears me?

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Shhh. Listen. Look at it this way: Now you got three choices. One, you chicken out. In that case, I let Ants tie you to the car and drag you around a little bit. And you don't want that, right?

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Two, you foul up and Holstein hears you and well, ah... you don't want that, right?

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: No, I don't.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Three, you are successful and you join the Pharoahs with a carcoat, and the blood initiation and all that, huh?

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Wait--wait a minute. Wait a minute! What blood initiation?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Hey, why don't we go get your jeep?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: What? What are you talking about?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: You know, your jeep. The one you sold the hunting ponies for. The one with the four-wheel drive.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Come on, Terry--Terry?

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Hey, you sure you got enough slack?

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah. No sweat. Let's get out of here.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Stand by for Justice!

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Why are we stopping here?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Carol...

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I--I don't think that I can control myself any longer.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: You can't?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: No... Carol, I've got to have you.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Me?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: All night you've been sitting there and you've been so sexy and it's been so hot--and I can't wait any more...

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Well--well, a lot of that's an act, you know. Like... like my crying. It was just an act.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Well, it's been building up inside of me like a volcano, all night. Maybe if I knew where you lived I could fight it--I could take you home--but since you won't tell me, and since here we are--I've got to have you. It's too late--

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: It's not too late! It's never too late! 231 Ramona--two three one--

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Two three one--

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: I'll show you! It's easy to find.

Speaker: budda
Dialogue: Hi. You mind if I sit down?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Hi Budda. No, have a seat.

Speaker: budda
Dialogue: I got five minutes outa the rat race, and I saw you all alone. For a change.

Speaker: budda
Dialogue: Where's Laurie?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: budda
Dialogue: I thought the two of you'd be going strong, this being your last night and everything--

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: We broke up.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: No big deal.

Speaker: budda
Dialogue: Wow... what happened?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Nothing. We were out at the canal and... we had a fight.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: What's so funny?

Speaker: budda
Dialogue: Nothing. Just thinking. A girl like Laurie--I mean, she goes to school and is cute and popular and all, but we're not so different. We know what we want. I've seen her after you for two years now.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: She's not like that.

Speaker: budda
Dialogue: Maybe not. She does have a different approach. Hers is "Never surrender," me I lay down my arms at the drop of a hat--

Speaker: budda
Dialogue: All right, relax... old fart. Listen, I'm off in an hour. If you wanta come over, my girlfriend's away for the weekend.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I don't know...

Speaker: budda
Dialogue: Why don't you? I never got a chance to talk to you. You're leaving tomorrow. Listen, I gave up a long time ago, so it'd be just for fun. No problems.

Speaker: budda
Dialogue: I'll see ya later then.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Budda, Budda wait.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I gotta get up early and--I just don't think it'd work out.

Speaker: budda
Dialogue: She's got you so brainwashed--well, hell. Some day I'm gonna win. Don't ya think?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Oh mother, it's been a glorious night.

Speaker: carlos
Dialogue: That was the bitchinest thing I ever seen in my whole life.

Speaker: ants
Dialogue: I seen a little kid attacked by pigs once, but this was even better.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Oh boy, I'll tell you something, that car must've jumped five feet in the air!

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: You sure you got to go? The night's young.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Yeah, there's some things I got to do. I still want to find that blonde.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: I think she was an optical delusion, man. Psychology-wise it ain't good to dwell on it. You'll alter your ego or something. Anyway, catch ya tomorrow night?

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Yeah, I guess so.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Guess so? Man, we don't admit a lot of guys to the Pharoahs. You understand we're going to have to swipe your jacket and all--you gotta make up your mind.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Hey--I'll see you guys.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: Sure--listen, remember, Rome wasn't buried in a night.

Speaker: wolfman
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Would you dedicate a record to keep me and my girlfriend together?

Speaker: wolfman
Dialogue: Are you separated?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Well, see, we're havin' a little problem.

Speaker: wolfman
Dialogue: I'll bring you right together. Hold on a minute, man. Hi ya, hi ya, hi, hi, hi. Everything's gonna be all right now, man, you understand? Now, let me play the record for you.

Speaker: falfa
Dialogue: Hey Hey Hey, baby, what do you say?

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Just don't say anything and we'll get along fine.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: This the first time you've been quiet all night.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: I had fun. Goodbye.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Do you like me?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah. I like you. You're all right.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: But I mean, do you like me?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I, ah... I like you. Okay?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Couldn't I have something to remember you by?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: 'Bye, kid.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Gee, thanks. It's just like a ring or something.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: It's like we were going steady. Wait'll I tell Marcia.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Wait a minute, now.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Wait'll I tell everybody.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Don't go overboard with this thing.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Well, I'll see you around.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Hold that up.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I've been thinking--maybe you're right. Why should I leave home to find a new home. Why should I leave friends that I love to find new friends?

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Wait a minute, wait a minute. I've heard this already. Aren't you the one who for eight weeks has been telling me you have to leave the nest sometime?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I realize that. I realize--

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: No--no realizing. You've been telling me all summer that it's time to pull your head out of the sand and take a look at the big, beautiful world out there. Gimme this thing.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I don't know--I--

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: I feel like a mid-wife.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I guess I was wrong. I may have been wrong.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Wrong nothing. You've been talking about getting out of this town for eight weeks. And now--goddamnit!-- you're just--you're just mentally playing with yourself. If you can just relax, we'll talk about it at the airport.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Where are you going? It's awfully early in the morning.

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: I have a dental appointment.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Come on, Curt...

Speaker: curt
Dialogue: Just relax, wil ya? I'll see you at the airport.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: I never seen a guy lose so much. He mustn't have been used to drinking.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Oh no, he really likes to drink. He told me.

Speaker: old man
Dialogue: Gettin' late... I knew a man once who got this sick. Billy Webber. That was ten years ago. What do you think that was there, that he had for dinner?

Speaker: old woman
Dialogue: Staying on his hands and knees like that...  He looks like a dog, doesn't he? Looks like old Ginger.

Speaker: old man
Dialogue: Sicker than a dog, that's for sure.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Ohh rats, I feel like--  Wait a second... hey!

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: It's--oh my god--it looks like Steve's car. Look, right here under our-- it's my car. My car. We found it. Look!

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Maybe we oughta call the police.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Never get here in time. I got a better idea. We'll just steal it back. See if you can find some wire around. We only need a foot to hot-wire it... okay?

Speaker: attendant
Dialogue: Took the header plugs off. Expectin' some action?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah. Think so. There's some punk lookin' for me.

Speaker: attendant
Dialogue: Why the hell do they bother? You've been number one as long as I can remember.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah... it's been a long time, ain't it? I'll see ya. Thanks.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Ah, hi--this is my car. What I mean is, somebody stole my car--I mean I lost my car and I want to thank you two guys for--

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: --for returning--I mean finding it. I mean, listen now, listen guys-- I've been sick recently, and this kind of activity can really be hard on a guy. Now, easy will you? Easy!

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Stop it, stop it, stop it! Help! Police! You creeps!

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Go, John!

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Hit him!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Hey, man, you all right?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Yeah. I'll die soon and it'll all be over.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Wow--you're just like the Lone Ranger.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah. Listen, are you with the Toad, or were you with them?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: You're talking to the woman I love...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: What happened, man?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Hi, Karen, Judy.

Dialogue: Hi, Steve. Have you seen Laurie lately?

Speaker: judy
Dialogue: Well, we have.

Dialogue: Oh yeah. So what?

Speaker: judy
Dialogue: So nothing. She was just with a really cute guy in a boss car. We wondered who he was.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I wouldn't know.

Speaker: judy
Dialogue: We do. His name's Bob Falfa.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Help... I mean, I want two cherry cokes with lots of ice. Never mind, forget the cokes, just bring the ice, pronto.

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: Out! OUT!

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: What??

Dialogue: I need the car--now.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: What's going on?

Speaker: steve
Dialogue: I'm about to find out.

Dialogue: I don't believe it! You practically get killed trying to get your car back, then you let him have it.

Dialogue: It's not my car.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: What?

Dialogue: IT IS NOT MY CAR!

Dialogue: Well, where is your car?

Dialogue: I DON'T HAVE A CAR!

Dialogue: You don't--no car at all. What about your jeep?

Dialogue: No car... well, how am I going to get home?

Dialogue: Where's your car? I gotta hook 'em to your car.

Dialogue: What's wrong, Toad? You lose the car again?

Dialogue: No... Steve took it.

Dialogue: You know, I had a pretty good time tonight.

Dialogue: Oh come on, you're just--

Dialogue: No, no, really. I really had a good time. I mean, you picked me up and we got some hard stuff and saw a hold-up, and then we went to the Canal, you got your car stolen, and then I got to watch you gettin' sick, and then you got in this really bitchin' fight... I really had a good time.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: You think so? Yeah--well I guess I have pretty much fun every night.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Anyway if you're not doing anything tomorrow night, why don't you come over?

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Yeah--well, I might be busy, you know. But we could--well, I got a little Vespa I just play around with.

Dialogue: Really? Why that's almost a motorcycle. And I just love motorcycles.

Dialogue: I got to go.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Ow.

Dialogue: Goodnight.

Dialogue: See ya.

Dialogue: We don't take no deliveries after eight. Come back tomorrow.

Dialogue: No, I can't. I want to ask him something that--
